name: Euphorbium
Relationship: Euphorbia corollate-Large Flowering Spurge (a diaphoretic expectorant and cathartic of the old school in gastroenteric disturbance, with deathly nausea. Vomiting of food, water, and mucus, and copious evacuations. Attacks recur after short intermissions. Feeling of clawing in stomach; cold sweat). (Verat. alb.)Antidotes: Camph.; Opium.Euphorbia marginata-Snow on the mountain - (Honey from the flowers is poisonous, detected by the hot, acrid taste. The milky juice produces skin symptoms like Rhus).Compare: Euphorbia amygdaloides-Wood Spurge (in pain in antrum, illusion of smell, ODOR OF MICE. Sense of taste blunted. Diarrhoea; stools difficult, with painful anal spasm).Euphorbia pilulifera-Pillbearing Spurge - (Humid asthma, cardiac dyspnoea, hay-fever, and bronchitis. Urethritis, with intense pain on urinating, and much urging. Acrid leucorrhoea; worse least movement. Hemorrhages from sunstroke and traumatism).Compare, also: Psoralea-A Colombian plant - (Pain of cancer, ulcers. Leucorrhoea fetid., Pruritus. Uterine tumors.) Croton; Jatropha; Colchic.
Common names: Spurge-The Resinous Juice of Euphorbia Resinifera

Head: Acute mania
Violent, pressive headache
Respiratory: Warm feeling in chest, as if hot food had been swallowed
Violent, fluent coryza, with burning and cough
Spasmodic, dry cough, day and night, with asthma
Breathing oppressed as if chest were not wide enough
Constant cough, with stitches from pit of stomach to sides of chest
Face: Eyes inflamed and agglutinated in morning
Nasal pruritus with mucous secretions from nasopharynx
Skin: Carbuncle; old, torpid, indolent ulcers with biting, lancinating pain
Erysipelatous inflammation, especially of the cheek
Ulcerating carcinoma and epithelioma of the skin

details: An irritant to the skin and mucous membranes. Burning pain in bones. Pains in limbs and paralytic weakness in the joints. Important respiratory and skin symptoms. Terrible burning pains. PAINS OF CANCER. Everything appears larger than it really is.
